reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Support for the Strengthening of High-Impact Prevention Interventions for Sustainable Malaria Control through a Resilient and Sustainable Health System in Burundi (ARIPP-SRPS)

description.narrative: Burundi - Malaria - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Burundi. This program has the following goals: Réduire la morbidité liée au paludisme d'au moins 60% en 2023 Reduce malaria morbidity by at least 60% by 2023. Réduire à Zéro la mortalité liée au paludisme en 2023 Reduce malaria mortality to zero by 2023. The objectives of this program are: Assurer et maintenir une couverture universelle des ménages en MIILDAS et atteindre au moins 80% de taux d'utilisation dans la population générale d’ici 2023 ; Achieve and maintain universal household coverage of LLINs and reach at least 80% utilization rate in the general population by 2023;. Assurer et maintenir une couverture d’au moins 95% des structures en aspersion intra domiciliaires dans les zones ciblées ; To ensure and maintain a coverage of at least 95% of the structures in intra-household spraying in the targeted areas;. Assurer la couverture en Tpig selon les directives nationales d’au moins 80% des femmes enceintes d’ici 2023 ; Ensure IPTp coverage according to national guidelines for at least 80% of pregnant women by 2023;. Assurer la prise en charge conformément à la politique nationale de 100% des cas suspects de paludisme reçus dans les formations sanitaires d’ici 2023 ; Ensure that, in accordance with the national policy, 100% of suspected malaria cases received in health facilities are treated by 2023;. Assurer la prise en charge conformément à la politique nationale de 100% des cas suspects de paludisme au niveau communautaire d’ici 2023 ; Ensure that, in accordance with the national policy, 100% of suspected malaria cases received in health facilities are treated by 2023;. Assurer qu’au moins de 90% des formations sanitaires et ASC disposent continuellement de stock d’intrants antipaludiques ; Ensure that at least 90% of health facilities and CHWs have a continuous supply of antimalarial inputs;. Amener au moins 80% de la population à adopter des comportements favorables à la lutte contre le paludisme d’ici 2023 At least 80% of the population to adopt behaviours favourable to the fight against malaria by 2023. Renforcer les capacités managériales, techniques et institutionnelles du programme national de lutte contre le paludisme à tous les niveaux d’ici 2023 ; Strengthen the managerial, technical, and institutional capacity of the national malaria control program at all levels by 2023. Assurer qu'au moins 95% des formations sanitaires fournissent des données de qualité sur le paludisme d’ici 2023 Ensure that at least 95% of health facilities provide quality data on malaria by 2023. Assurer la détection précoce de 100% des épidémies de paludisme d’ici 2023 Ensure early detection of 100% of malaria epidemics by 2023. Maîtriser 100% des épidémies détectées dans les deux semaines d’ici 2023 Control 100% of detected epidemics within two weeks by 2023

title.narrative: Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
CM - other1: Percentage of CHWs not having had a stock-out for ACTs or RDTs during the reporting period in the 30 districts implementing iCCM.
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
M&E - other1: Percentage of CHWs having submitted their monthly reports in a timely manner, from the community to the health centres.
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at private sector sites
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at private sector sites
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
